intro: Elaeodendron alluaudianum, commonly known as the Madagascar velvet tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its bark is thick and corky, providing a protective layer against environmental stress. Elaeodendron alluaudianum is often found in moist, shaded forest habitats.
